WorkItem.ClosedComment: Unable to reproduce, if this is still an issue, please repost
WorkItem.Description:
I'm using Rawr v2.2.24 and I receive the following error when trying to load my character from the armory.
 
The error I receive is:
Step Name: Get Character
Description: Rawr encountered an error retrieving the Character - nedd@US-Norgannon from the armory
Input string was not in a correct format.
   at System.Number.StringToNumber(String str, NumberStyles options, NumberBuffer& number, NumberFormatInfo info, Boolean parseDecimal)
   at System.Number.ParseInt32(String s, NumberStyles style, NumberFormatInfo info)
   at System.Int32.Parse(String s)
   at Rawr.Armory.GetCharacter(CharacterRegion region, String realm, String name, String[]& itemsOnCharacter)
 
Character Name: Nedd
Realm: Norgannon
Region: US
 
Any help would be greatly appreciated.  Thanks.
WorkItem.Summary: [LoadCharacter] Error: Input string not in correct format

Comments.Message: I wasn't able to reproduce this.
I am also using 2.2.24 and I was able to load you right up.
I'm also using Rawr v2.2.24 and i get the error message "no character returned from the armory", my characters name is Trãûmä on server spirestone, any help would be greatly appreciated
I tried the same steps on a different PC and the character load from armory worked.  Still not sure why it fails from the laptop, but it's working fine now on the other PC.  Thanks.
I am also getting the "no charachter returned from the armory" message when trying to load charachters into Rawr.

'No Character returned from the Armory' usually means a proxy setting is wrong, your internet is dying, your firewall is blocking it or the armory isn't responding correctly. None of these are bugs in Rawr.

The OP however does indicate a possible issue, but the dev's aren't able to reproduce. If it's only happening on one system, try redownloading Rawr.
